author: radekkapka
content:
Every once in a while a user complains that the state endpoint returned a 404 error. It's because the endpoint is in the `debug` namespace and we don't want to enable `debug` by default. I wonder whether there is a case of moving the endpoint to `beacon`. The reason is that the resulting state is less than fetching all validators from `/eth/v1/beacon/states/{state_id}/validators`:
- `/eth/v1/beacon/states/head/validators` is 410MB
- `/eth/v2/debug/beacon/states/head` is 369MB

author: radekkapka
content: If I remember correctly, the size of the response was the main reason to have the state endpoint in `debug`

author: ogenev
content: Hey what would be the most feasible way to get the latest finalized checkpoint block root (first slot of the last finalized epoch? ) using beacon apis?

author: jgm
content: I wouldn't be averse to it moving to being present in the `beacon` namespace, as long as we have a suitable period (_e.g._ 1 hard fork) where the old endpoint is available as well (marked deprecated so that users have a suitable timeframe in which to migrate).

author: tersec
content: One upside might be that the `debug` namespace was  easier to then treat as truly `debug`. It's a bit odd  that this widely used `getState` endpoint lives in `debug` in that regard
